description: The nail sword, or nord for short.  This wooden sword has a dozen nails sticking at jagged angles from edge of the blade, making it much better at chopping than slashing.
This is a large, two-handed wood axe.  It makes a good melee weapon, but is a bit slow to recover between swings.
This is a huge axe designed for warfare.  Though intended for use as a weapon, it can also be pressed into service as a rather clumsy woodcutting tool.
This is sturdy wood bat, wrapped in gasoline-soaked rags and flame-resistant Nomex fabric.  Light it, and the ball game will REALLY heat up.  You'll need a lighter or matches to light it.

This is a sturdy wood bat, wrapped in gasoline-soaked rags and flame-resistant Nomex fabric.  It is burning brightly, and makes it much easier to see the baselines at night games (It also makes the umpire FAR more likely to call a ball instead of a strike).
This is a combination of two Dark Age conflict-resolution classics, the broadsword and the torch.  Use to light it up and show those heathen zombies who's Lord around here.
This is a combination of two Dark Age conflict-resolution classics, the broadsword and the torch.  The blade is glowing with heat.  Excalibur can eat its heart out.  Use to shut it off.

use_action.water_extinguish_message: Your sword hisses in the water and goes out.

description: This is an early modern sword seeing use in the 16th, 17th, and 18th centuries.  Called 'broad' to contrast with the slimmer rapiers.
This is a decent-sized chunk of worked copper affixed to a wooden shaft, to make a crude yet effective axe.
This is a hefty prying tool.  Use it to open locked doors without destroying them or to lift manhole covers.  You could also wield it to bash some heads in.
This is a broad saber known for its use by sailors and pirates, as its short blade is easy to handle in close quarters.
This is a large, two-handed pickhead axe normally used by firefighters.  It makes a powerful melee weapon, but is a bit slow to recover between swings.
This huge steel knife makes an excellent tool for cutting down large vegetation or other 'obstacles.'
This huge steel knife has been modified with a fuel tank, insulated handguard, and ignition system.  When filled with gasoline, a system of torches heats the blade, burning your target.
This huge steel knife has been modified with a fuel tank, insulated handguard, and ignition system.  The blade is glowing with heat, making it a great plant scorcher and nightlight.

use_action.water_extinguish_message: Your No. 9 hisses in the water and goes out.

description: This is a katana with a nozzle just behind the cutting edge of the blade.  People love fire, and people love katanas, so why not put them together?  The gas burners attached to this blade can really turn up the heat on your foes.  Use to ignite.
This is a katana that glows with the fury and heat of the SUN!  Well, okay it's not THAT hot, but getting hit with it still stings like the dickens.  Use to shut off the gas.

use_action.water_extinguish_message: Your sword hisses in the water and goes out.

description: This is a heavy multiple-use tool commonly carried by firefighters, law enforcement, and military rescue units.  Use it to open locked doors without destroying them or to lift manhole covers.  You could also wield it to bash some heads in.
This is a demagnetized steel hammer with a wooden grip.  With a hammer, nails, and two by fours in your inventory, you could board up adjacent doors and windows.  It has myriad other uses as well.
This is an ice axe with hammer on its head, a multi-purpose hiking and climbing tool used by mountaineers.  It is sturdy enough, so you can use it to pry open closed doors or lift manhole covers.
This is a rare sword from Japan.  Deadly against unarmored targets, and still very effective against armor.
This is a military combat knife.  It is light and extremely sharp, and could be deadly in either the right hands or when attached as a bayonet.

//: Highest non-powertool butchering quality.  It's made for skinning and butchering game, which is what you're generally doing.
description: Commonly used by hunters, this single-edge sheath knife is designed for cutting and skinning game rather than combat.

//: This isn't really supposed to be a very good knife, or a very good saw.  It's more for looking scary.
description: This massive knife features a hollow handle with a compass built into the pommel and a row of fearsome looking saw teeth along the back of its blade.

This sturdy matte black Rivtech combat dagger features a long and slim double-edged blade with a spear-point and a distinctive slip-resistant grip which can also be used to affix it to a suitable firearm.  Originally manufactured for the military, it was very popular in films and among collectors due to its fearsome appearance.
This stout combat knife features a steel guard to protect the user's knuckles.  The guard can also be used for striking or blocking, and the knife can also be used to butcher corpses.
This wavy bladed dagger comes from Southeast Asia.  The design of the blade causes it to make broad, painful wounds.
This versatile implement is a modern take on a traditional weapon that originated in Nepal.  Featuring a heavy blade with an inwardly curved edge, it is used as both a tool and as a weapon.

Produced by the Light corporation, this stylish staff not only functions as a light source, but doubles as a light-weight weapon, due to the superalloy materials it is made of.  Due to proprietary efficiency improvements over standard light sources, the l-stick or light stick as it is commonly called, batteries last longer than other light sources.

Produced by the Light corporation, this stylish staff not only functions as a light source, but doubles as a light-weight weapon, due to the superalloy materials it is made of.  Due to proprietary efficiency improvements over standard light sources, the l-stick or light stick as it is commonly called, batteries last longer than other light sources.  The staff is glowing brightly, which is slowly draining the batteries.
This is a crude hammer make from a piece of metal affixed to a stick.  It functions adequately as a hammer, but really can't compare to a proper one.
This is an unwieldy mop.  Good for cleaning up spills.  Use to mop up any 'mess' you may have made.
This is a large steel pickaxe, suitable for breaking up hard things or (with enough skill) hard targets.  Strike the earth!
This is a sharpened stone affixed to a stick.  It works passably well as an axe but really can't compare to a proper axe.
This is a rock affixed to a stick, in the crude facsimile of a hammer.  It functions adequately as a hammer, but really can't compare to a proper one.
This is a thin sword with an ornate hand guard.  It looks like the preferred weapon of gentlemen and swashbucklers.  Light and quick, it makes any battle a stylish battle.
This is a very sharp knife designed for surgical cutting.  It's small, sharp blade allows for precision strikes in the hands of the skilled.

This is an ironshod quarterstaff that has a high-voltage stun gun built into the handle.  The stun gun is wired to the metal caps at either end of the staff, allowing you to zap a dangerous opponent should beating them senseless with it prove too hazardous.

This is a reinforced plastic tonfa; the core is hollowed out and is filled with capacitors and a battery compartment.  When a switch on the handle is pressed, a high-voltage current is transmitted to the two electrodes mounted in the end of the tonfa, and by extension to anyone unfortunate enough to be in contact with them.  It's currently turned off.

use_action.msg: You press a button and the tonfa crackles with electricity.

description: This is a reinforced plastic tonfa; the core is hollowed out and is filled with capacitors and a battery compartment.  When a switch on the handle is pressed, a high-voltage current is transmitted to the two electrodes mounted in the end of the tonfa, and by extension to anyone unfortunate enough to be in contact with them.  It's currently turned on.

use_action.msg: You press a button and the tonfa turns off.

description: This is a digging tool.  Use it to dig pits adjacent to your location.
This is a farming implement.  Use it to turn tillable land into a slow-to-cross pile of dirt.
A hefty nickel-alloy candlestick with a solid base and gold gilding.  The kind used by Professor Plum to kill Dr. Black in the study.
This is a long and thin knife with a spring-loaded blade that rests inside the handle while not in use.

Long Japanese knives like this more-modern remake were the samurai's backup weapon, before the advent of the larger wakizashi.  It's still a deadly blade, even if it's smaller than its more famous relatives.
This is a large stick, wrapped in rags that are soaked with a flammable material.  When lit, produces a fair amount of light.  You'll need a lighter or matches to light it.
This is a large stick, wrapped in rags that are soaked with a flammable material.  It is burning, producing plenty of light.
This is a comparatively-common Japanese short sword.  Smaller and lighter than a katana, but still effective in combat.
This is an adjustable crescent wrench.  It could be a decent melee weapon, and is used in many mechanics crafting recipes.

A large hammer, forged from the heart of a dying star.  It bears the inscription:
 
Whosoever holds this hammer,
If he be worthy,
Shall possess the power to...
CRUSH!!'

This is a solid wood 'training' katana, exactingly crafted to mimic the weight and balance of the real thing.  Despite its lack of a sharp metal edge, it's still quite capable of inflicting deadly wounds.
//: MA reference I used held that a bokken crushes rather than cuts (or impales) but is otherwise just as damaging as a katana.  Nerfed by popular demand.

description: A slender long rod of wood, while traditionally intended as a training tool for many dueling moves, it still makes a good melee weapon in a pinch.
A smooth and sturdy staff with a leather-wrapped grip.  Light and well-balanced, it is surprisingly easy to handle.
A smooth and sturdy staff with a leather-wrapped grip, which has been reinforced with metal bands and caps.  Durable and well-balanced, it is surprisingly easy to handle.
An exotic weapon comprised of a long pole of wood with curved blades on each end.  It can be deadly in skilled hands.
A one-handed hatchet.  Makes a great melee weapon, and is useful both for chopping things and for use as a hammer.
A simple wood pole with one end sharpened.
A long-handled broom.  Makes a terrible weapon unless you're chasing cats.
A large, heavy hammer.  Makes an acceptable melee weapon for the very strong, but is nearly useless in the hands of the weak.
A baseball bat with several nails driven through it, an excellent melee weapon.
A baseball bat wrapped with barbed wire.  A brutal melee weapon.
A medieval hammer made for battle.  Its odd shape and balance make it an excellent weapon, but an ineffective tool.
//: Craftable from steel, shouldn't be silver.  A warhammer is essentially one end of a pickaxe with balancing weight on the other and crushes/pierces the armor.

description: A long piece of wood with several chunks of steel firmly tied to it.  The resulting weapon is unwieldy and slow but very heavy hitting.
A blunt bowling pin.  Makes a decent melee weapon, if somewhat short.
An aluminum baseball bat, lighter than a wooden bat and a little easier to swing as a result.
This is a simple wood pole made much more deadly by the blade tied to it.
A stout pole with an improvised grip and a fire-hardened point.
A stout wooden pole with a spearhead worked from copper.
A stout wooden pole with a hand-forged steel spearhead.
A heavy, stout metal pole with a sharp point.
//: Changed the weight, affecting strike speed.

description: An ancient Chinese spear, typically with a tassel just below the spearhead.  One of the four major weapons in folklore, alongside the dao sabre, jian sword, and gun staff.
A telescoping baton that collapses for easy storage.  Makes an excellent melee weapon.  Activate to collapse.
A medieval weapon consisting of a wood handle with a heavy iron end.  It is heavy and slow, but its crushing damage is devastating.
//: Same total damage and slightly higher weight than a morningstar - exchanged.

description: A medieval weapon consisting of a wood handle with a heavy, spiked iron ball on the end.  It deals devastating crushing damage, with a small amount of piercing to boot.
Short and sharp claws made from a high-tech metal.
A short and sharp double edged dagger made to be gripped in the palm, with the blade protruding between the fingers.
Also called bagh nakha or iron paw, this is a small claw-like bladed weapon from India designed to be concealed under and against the palm.
A heavy metal guard that covers the fist and increases striking power, with stout padding underneath to protect the wearers hand.
A hard plastic truncheon commonly employed by police.  Originally an Okinawan weapon, it consists of a stick with a perpendicular handle attached a third of the way down its length.
A stout wooden truncheon of the sort commonly employed by police.  Originally an Okinawan weapon, it consists of a stick with a perpendicular handle attached a third of the way down its length.
The Monadnock PR-24 baton is a collapsible, lightweight, side-handle baton used by law enforcement all over the world.  The PR designation is rumored to mean Public Relations.  Activate to retract.

//: Id retained to avoid breaking anything, same reason as with the makeshift glaive.
description: A flat wooden club with sharpened pieces of stone sticking to both of its sides.
A weapon used for fencing, the most noble of all sports.  Unfortunately, a fencing foil is rather useless as a weapon, due to its flexible shaft and dull tip.
A weapon used for fencing, the most noble of all sports.  The epee is the heaviest and stiffest of the fencing weapons, and therefore perhaps the most useful.
A weapon used for fencing, the most noble of all sports.  The fencing saber is marginally shorter than the foil and epee, but no less effective.
A sock with a rock tied into the end of it.  A true weapon of desperation.
This is a dull, cheaply made replica of a broad saber known for its use by sailors and pirates.
This is a broad saber known for its use by sailors and pirates.  This sword appears to be made very poorly, but it should still stand up to a few swings.
This is a dull, cheaply made replica of a rare sword from Japan.
This is a rare sword from Japan.  While it's got the right edge and weight, the pommel just snaps off, and the blade seems pretty worn.
This is a blunted, cheap replica of a thin sword with an ornate hand guard.  It looks like the preferred weapon of gentlemen and swashbucklers.  Light and quick, it makes any battle a stylish battle.
This is a dull, cheap replica of the more common wakizashi.  Smaller and lighter than a katana, but still effective in combat.
This is a comparatively-common Japanese short sword.  There's something not quite right about this sword.
This is a dull, cheap replica of a wavy bladed dagger that comes from Southeast Asia.
This is a thin sword resembling a longsword, a sort of predecessor to the rapier.  It requires a larger baldric or scabbard, compared to smaller swords.
This is a dull, cheaply-made replica of a thin sword resembling a longsword.  It requires a larger baldric or scabbard, compared to smaller swords.
A long, narrow, and solid piece of metal, separated by force from whatever it was attached to.  Though heavy and unwieldly, it makes an excellent melee weapon if you can handle it.
A solid wrought shaft of metal, sharpened into an arrowtip and given a leather grip to provide it more versatility.  Still somewhat ungainly to use, and too heavy to use as a proper spear.
